extendedIngredients.name: granny smith apple
extendedIngredients.original: 2 tablespoons finely chopped Granny Smith apple

extendedIngredients.name: lime juice
extendedIngredients.original: 2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon fresh lime juice

extendedIngredients.name: lump crabmeat
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound jumbo lump crabmeat, picked over

extendedIngredients.name: watermelon
extendedIngredients.original: 4 1/2-inch-thick half-round watermelon slices from a large watermelon, rind removed
extendedIngredients.originalName: thick half-round watermelon slices from a large watermelon, rind removed

title: Curried Crab and Watermelon Salad with Arugula
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Curried Crab and Watermelon Salad with Arugulan a try. For $5.01 per serving, this recipe covers 24% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Watching your figure? This gluten free, dairy free, whole 30, and pescatarian recipe has 399 calories, 22g of protein, and 33g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 4. It is perfect for Summer. 1 person found this recipe to be yummy and satisfying. Head to the store and pick up olive oil, salt, lime juice, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the pepper you could follow this main course with the Easy Peppermint Dessert as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 35 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 63%. This score is pretty good. Try Watermelon-Arugula Salad, Arugula & Watermelon Salad, and Watermelon Arugula Salad for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shellfish works really well with Chardonnay, Muscadet, and Riesling. Buttery chardonnay is great for scallops, shrimp, crab, and lobster, while muscadet is a classic pick for mussels, oysters, and clams. If you've got some spice in your shellfish, a semi-dry riesling can balance out the heat. One wine you could try is Lapis Luna Chardonnay. It has 4.7 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 13 dollars.

productMatches.title: Lapis Luna Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Orange zest, ripe pineapple, toast, and vanilla on the nose. Full-bodied, fresh and lively, with lush white peach and ripe apple flavors leading to a savory buttered finish.

instructions: In a saucepan, heat 1 tablespoon of the oil. Add the apple, onion, curry and saffron and cook over moderate heat until the onion is softened, 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in 1 teaspoon of water; let cool.                                              Scrape the mixture into a mini food processor. Add the mayonnaise and process. Transfer the mayonnaise to a bowl and add the cilantro and mint. Season with salt and pepper, then fold in the crabmeat.                                              Cut each slice of watermelon into 2 triangles and transfer to 4 plates. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle each plate with 1 teaspoon of lime juice. Mound the crab salad on the watermelon. In another bowl, toss the arugula with the remaining 1 tablespoon of lime juice and the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil and season with salt and pepper. Arrange the arugula on the plates and serve.

steps.step: In a saucepan, heat 1 tablespoon of the oil.
Add the apple, onion, curry and saffron and cook over moderate heat until the onion is softened, 5 minutes.
Remove from the heat and stir in 1 teaspoon of water; let cool.
Scrape the mixture into a mini food processor.
Transfer the mayonnaise to a bowl and add the cilantro and mint. Season with salt and pepper, then fold in the crabmeat.

Cut each slice of watermelon into 2 triangles and transfer to 4 plates. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle each plate with 1 teaspoon of lime juice. Mound the crab salad on the watermelon. In another bowl, toss the arugula with the remaining 1 tablespoon of lime juice and the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil and season with salt and pepper. Arrange the arugula on the plates and serve.
